docs.title: Please give us the LG G5 H82020J OTA URL.
docs.text: n behalf of the abroad wwireless and xda community, we would like to know where we may download the h82020j ota file for the wwireless lg g5 phone. also, i don't think wwireless has taken into consideration that nougat now has an enforced-state dm verity security function which may fail for no fault of the user, requiring an original tot/kdz file to restore our phones to an operable condition. now, we know that the lg g5 nougat ota file is located on an wwireless server address such as or similar to https://xdm.wireless.wwireless.com/... or https://xdmd.sl.wwirelesscompute.com/agents/... with certain portions of related lg g5 build numbers following. we implore you for this peace offering.if you would be so kind as to offer us this information, we would be happy to continue supporting the wwireless brand.if you do not have authority in these mwwirelessers, we would appreciate a response from the lead authority on wwireless's lg ota software department.thank you.

docs.title: Trade-In Credit Not Received; After Six Months, No Resolution
docs.text: took advantage of the fall wwireless promotion that promised $650 worth of credits towards a new iphone 7 32gb (ultimately making the iphone 7 free) if a fully paid for and good working iphone 6, 6 plus, 6s, or 6s plus is traded in. the promotion ended on september 30, 2016.i called into wwireless requesting the iphone 7 for a new line i was adding to my account, and i told them that i wanted this with the promotion. this phone call took place on september 25th, 2016. the phone was on backorder due to popularity of the item at this time. when i received the new black iphone 7 in the mail, i promptly took my rose gold iphone 6, 64gb to my local wwireless store to complete the trade-in process. my iphone 6 was received at the wwireless store on october 3, 2016.i was told the trade-in credit would be applied to my account no more than three months after these transactions. six months into this, i have yet to see those credits applied. i have called wwireless customer service each month with no result or explanation, wasting hours of my time and energy. i have visited my local wwireless store, and i am met with blank stares and no answers. i am continually told that a new case will be filed, and i should receive a resolution in several business days. i have asked several times over for the phone number or the name of someone that can help me and/or give me an answer as to when this will be resolved, but i am told each time that there is no one that i can speak with. "we don't have those phone numbers." i have yet to be contacted by anyone with any information after filing multiple cases. i am still be charged monthly for the iphone 7, and i have received no credit for my iphone 6 that i traded in.i am very frustrated by the lack of support and information that i have received after a laughable amount of time. i almost feel as though wwireless has stolen me from considering that my iphone 6 was taken without compensation, and now i am being charged for a phone that was supposed to cost me nothing.today alone i spent over two hours on the phone before finally speaking with the highest authority i was allowed. her name was katrina g., and she was located in central florida. my latest case number is available as well as my previous case numbers. is there any way that i can have someone with authority and answers to my questions regarding this reach out to me?

docs.title: $200 Gift Card
docs.text: wo weeks ago when i placed an order with wwireless for an ipad pro, i told them about the sale price that verizon had for theirs. so, to price match verizon, i was offered a $200 coupon/gift card that was supposed to be mailed to me. not only that but i never received any notifications regarding my order for the ipad. i called a few times, i was on the phone for hours being transfered from one department to the other who had no clue as to who offered this coupon to me, or why my order hasn't been processed.2 weeks later, i still don't have my ipad, and nobody still has any idea what i'm talking about regarding my $200 visa gift card.i even spoke with a supervisor because i'm so tired of being on the phone for hours every week when i have a child who needs my wwirelessention. this supervisor couldn't even help me and transfered me to a department who didn't know how to solve the issue either!i've been an wwireless customer for at least 2 years, and i'm unhappy with this unresolved issue.

docs.title: Request for phone unlock
docs.text: paid for my i phone and account is up to date to request wwireless to unlock my phone. i received an email on march 01 stating that my phone did not required a password and it was ready to be unlocked following the steps stated. i tried to installed a sim card to be denied with a message that the phone has not been unlocked... i have talked to three different associates with different stories... last is aid my phone has not been unlocked and he did not understand why since everything looks in order. i asked that they needed to unlock my phone so i can use it. he said that they have no access to the unlock team and could not help me but request the phone to be unlocked for the fourth time... his manager is supposed to call me back ... it has been two hours and i still have no acces to my phone. why is wwireless holding my phone ramson? how do i get a hold of the unlock department.

docs.title: Illegal AT&T deductible taxation.
docs.text: just received my replacement phone through the wwireless/assurion claim process. thats another story for another day. i was billed a 1 time deductible of $225, which was then taxed by wwireless. when i talked to the corporate store manager, she confirmed that an insurance deductible is non taxable. i called wwireless customer service, they said it wasn't them, call assurion, asked to speak to manager, they said the exact same. called assurion, they stated that the deductible is non taxable and they have no control over that. they just charge the 1 time fee and couldn't even access the bill, to call wwireless. called wwireless back again spoke to rep and manager, both confirmed that wwireless policy states that they charge tax on deductibles. i asked for written confirmation of deductible taxation, was told they won't provide that to me, they don't have to. i am requesting written documentation of this policy. especially since it is illegal taxation of a non taxable fee. this is my final wwirelessempt before pursuing legal avenues.

docs.title: Iphone6plus $650 credit promo Sept 2016 NOT YET CREDITED to my account until now March 2017.
docs.text: w have been chwwirelessing and calling wwireless about the $650 credit and my wife even had to beg to speak to a supervisor and had been given an escalated case number but we tried calling many times and customer reps kept saying the case is still ongoing when in fact they told us that since it is escalated case we are going to get a callback on 2/22/17 but they never did. we called to follow-up and were told they don't have any update on our case and they said they they have extended the callback but cannot give a definite date and said they are working with the rebate center. they even said they going to give $25 credit to my accounr for the trouble of being promised a callback but they never did give it nor call us back. it's past 4 billing cycles and i don't see any $650 credit and the installment plan for my line is not reflecting any future adjustments for me to get that $650 credit. it is so frustrating to be fooled like this by wwireless! the worst customer service ever! we are literally crying in frustration right now! we feel like being scammed by wwireless! i have an escalated case but they don't do anything! so frustrating! this is so unfair! we want to transfer now to a different company!!!!!please readers help us! who should we email or write a letter to regarding this!

docs.title: Please Help 5 months of getting harrased by ATT for a device that i returned in a store
docs.text: an someone please help or lead me in the right dirrection, on 28 september 2016 i returned a device at a wwireless retail store because i didnt like the color, the wwireless store returned the device gave me a receipt of the returned device and ordered me the correct phone i wanted. in october i began receiving harrasing text messages then letters from wwireless stating that if i didnt return that specific device (the one i returned on 28 sep 2016) that they were going to charge me $833.74, long story short i called wwireless about 20-40 different times and they told me not to worry that they received the device and that the device had actually been recycled already and another customer had bought it, to ignore the text messages and letters from wwireless that they were in error, long story short come december 2016 i received a letter that my account was being charged $833.74 for not turning in the device and i verified my bill that in fact it had been charged $833.74. here i am today march 6 2017 the $833.74 charge is still on my account even though every wwireless rep has verified the device was recycled and resold and another wwireless customer currently owns it, what can i do, ive already spent over 200 hours of my personal time calling wwireless and have spoken to every department on the wwireless side and unified side and the cases they create go no where and the so called promises of the problem being resolved and the account credited in 3-5 days for their mistake never happens. does anyone know how i can escalate this to levels above the actual escalation team, its been over 5 months of talking to wwireless over the phone and store and they realize the charge is a mistake but no one knows how to take it off the bill, its very stressing to deal with this type of issue with such a large company such as wwireless for such a simple mistake that could be fixed in 2 minutes.

docs.title: What is the lifetime value of your customers AT&T? Assume it is more than $649!
docs.text: never submit/post claims about companies, i have a very high tolerance threshold, however, i have never had such a frustrating and maddening experience as i have had with wwireless wireless over the past four months. their organization from new accounts to customer service to loyalty group is broken, unethical and lacks accountability to their customers.november 2016:i was starting a new and looking to open a personal line with a wireless provider. i was going to add a line to my husbands plan (sprint). a relative mentioned that since we were wsatellite customers i should look at wwireless for bundling discounts.i called in (and visited an wwireless store) november 2016. at that time, they were running a promotion for directv customers starting a new wireless service with wwireless  a free iphone 7. between the free iphone, my corporate discounts and the bundling discount, wwireless was more economical than joining sprint. my former employer released my corporate number to me (i had had the phone line for 15+ years) and i was on my way.when i activated my account i was offered the free iphone 7 as part of their promotion that month. i gave them my phone number for porting. by the time it was all said and done i was told my bill would be around $60 before taxes. great, right? not really.december 2016:i called because my first/november bill was over $200 (3x what i was quoted). they said there were severalfirst-time fees since i was a new customer and but this would be the only month it would be so high, after that, there woulnd't be any additional feesand my bill would be $60 before taxes. great, right? not really.january 2017:i called in again (and had to follow up with chat customer service because i got disconnected). my december bill was $90 and more one-time fees were on my bill. i was reassured this was the last month that the bill would be so high and it would drop down to $60 before taxes for february. it was also called out that my original phone line (the one i transferred in) would always show an equipment charge but the other line (that the new iphone was set up under) would always show on my bill with an equipment credit to cancel one another out and therefore no charge. great, right? not really.february 2017:i received my january billing and for the third month in a row, it did not reflect what i had been communicated multiple times. the total was $80; i was getting an equipment charge on my original line but the other line where the equipment credit had disappeared.2/13: i chwwirelessed customer service. i was told they would issue an equipment credit for february as they looked into it further with icu (they were going to file a case). i was told to check back in 48 hours and i would see the credit. i never saw the credit.2/18: (five days later, 40-minute call with customer service) i said i was following up on the customer chat because it had been 5-daysand i didnt see the credit on my bill nor had anyone followed up with me. she apologized and let me know that no one had actuallysubmitteda file on 2/13 but she would do that andsomeone get back to me with answers within the next72-hours. she confirmed that i was offered and told i qualified for the free iphone in november but then it showed that since it was an existing corporate line ported in that i should not have been given that promotion and did not qualify. (this was communicated to me on 2/18, more than 90-days after being told i did qualify for the offer).she said shewould credit the february equipment charge and get back to me within 72-hours.2/26: (eight days later, 20-minute call with customer service) i called in to follow up on the 2/18 conversation. i had not had any contact from wwireless and there was not a credit on my statement. i was told that they closed the case because i did not qualify for the offer. i reiterated that i was told that i would get a follow-up call (did not) and that the previous customer service rep confirmed that in november i was offered and told i qualified for the offer. i said i would never have got the iphone if it wasnt free and i would have reconsidered sprint as my option. he said there wasnt anything else he could do but he would have his supervisor contact me later.2/26: (three hours later, 50-minute call with customer service) i was told i because my line was ported in from an existing wwireless corporate account, i did not qualify for the promotion and had to pay for the phone. i said, i dont want the phone, i never really did and i certainly never would have purchased it for $649!!! i asked her to send me a box and i would return it to wwireless. she said since i was past the 14-day buyers remorse i could not return the phone and she could not honor the promotion. i reiterated that it was long past the buyers remorse deadline that i was informed i didnt qualify for the promotion what they were doing was unethical. i reiterated that i wanted my phone service to be at the $60 before taxes costs that i was repeatedly communicated and promised by multiple wwireless personnel. sheoffered to reduce my data plan to 1g and that would take my cost down $8. i repeatedly asked her to tell me what i did wrong to be penalized, all she could say is, you needed to port a non-wwireless line to get the promotion.as a person in marketing and the service industry, i am embarrassed for wwireless and their unethical practice. additionally, they are going to be losing a lot of easy business. they should have better assessed the lifetime value of having me for a customer (i guarantee you it is worth way more than $649).first, i am an auto pay and e-bill customer, no postage or follow ups for late bills here.second, i will be moving my directv service as well (which is unfortunate because i have always been very happy with their service and amazing customer service).last, not only will i be moving away from wwireless wireless, my two tweens that are getting phones this summer will not be joining wwireless as originally planned.

docs.title: Your unlock code is: 0. No, no it is not.
docs.text: hllo. i submitted an unlock request (as a non-wwireless customer) on the 23rd of feburary. i was just approved today.happy day right? nope.congratulations! your request was approvedimei:************request number: nul******hi, ***.we received and approved your request to unlock your huawei h1611 device. use the unlock code and instructions in this email to unlock your device.unlock code: 0instructions: "1. power off the device.2. insert any non-wwireless sim card. (the customer cannot unlock using an wwireless sim card).3. power on and the device prompts for the unlock code.4. enter the unlock code.5. press ok."for more information about unlocking a device, check out ourdevice unlock support page.thanks for choosing us,wwirelesszero is not a valid unlock code. i don't know what your automated approval system is doing, but i'm going to guess taking an extended lunch (for over a week.)given that your system was auto-bouncing people's requests at the time, is there any thing you can actually do to get me my unlock?

docs.title: Unlock my iPhone 5 and 5S requires additional research?
docs.text: n march 2nd, 2017 which is a couple days ago. i submitted the unlock request for my iphone 5 and iphone 5s. after submitting the request, i called wwireless customer service and they told me it would normally take 2 days for the request to be approved. today i received 2 emails with the following message:hi,thank you for contacting wwireless about unlocking your apple iphone 5.this request requires additional research to determine eligibility. thank you for your patience. we're actively working on it and will send a response as soon as possible.for more information about unlocking a device, check out our device unlock support page.thanks for choosing us,wwirelessso both of my iphones are currently still locked even though they told me it would only take 2 days for the request to go through. this is a classic example of over-promiseand under-delivery which is extremely frustarting for any customers to deal with. can someone help me out on expediting the unlock process?

docs.title: Wireless Home Phone & Internet "Home Base" - Data Cap on Unlimited Plus Plan?
docs.text: or the "home base" wireless home phone & internet device zte z700a.if this is put on the unlimited plus plan, what is the lte data cap?is it 22gb with a "soft cap" where they may deprioritize depending on network congestion or is it 10gb with a "hard cap" (drops to 128kbps)i've talked to numerous customer service reps. and i get a different answer every time. they can't agree on 10 or 22, but they all say they know for fact what they're telling me is true.the fine print for unlimited plus plan makes it sound like the whpi device is excluded from 10gb capwwireless unlimited plus: includes the stream saver feature which allows you to save data on content it recognizes as video by streaming higher definition video in standard definition quality (about 480p) on compatible devices (unless the video provider has opted out). wwireless will activate the feature for you. check your account online to see if the feature is active. once active, you can turn it off or back on at any time at wwireless.com/mywwireless or call 611. stream saver will not recognize all video content. ability to stream and video resolution may vary, and be affected by other factors. restrictions apply. see wwireless.com/streamsaver for more details. hd video: you can turn stream saver off at any time to enjoy access to high definition video streaming, if and when available. tethering and mobile hotspot: includes up to 10gb per line per month. after 10gb, tethering speed will be slowed to a max of 128kbps for the rest of the bill cycle (except for these products: connected cars, hot spots, and wireless home phone and internet.). except for those products, all tethering data usage, including sponsored data if tethered, will be impacted and will not be fully functional.has anyone actually bought a home base and reached the threshold on data yet with the new unlimited plus plan?i think that's the only way to know for sure how they treat data on that device

docs.title: AT&T Fraud Dept
docs.text: t the end of dec, i ordered (3) phones from wwireless, for myself, my daughter, and my son. i received and returned my phone as it wasnt right (iphone 7) and tried to reorder the correct one (iphone 7+). my daughter activated her phone immediately, and i waited to activate my son's phone for a couple of weeks. i was told by wwireless that i had until the beginning of feb to activate the phones, so i wasnt concerned until wwireless placed my account on a fraud hold. i spent 3 hours on the phone with customer service, and then 2 hours in the wwireless store, only for them to tell my nothing could be done. i asked the manager of the store, so my only option is to go to sprint. she said, yes. can you imagine? i feel this is not just and a form of robbery and feel like i am being treated like a criminal. i am a working mom of 3 children, and no where near doing anything related to fraud. i left the wwireless store extremely sad as they said on a number of times there is nothing i could do to rectify the situation. i do not feel it is fair that i am being charged $1300 for phones that i can not use. we have been loyal customers for 15+ years in some fashion.

docs.title: I thought I had bought 2 brand new phones
docs.text: went to my local wwireless store and they had a flash sale bogof. i was told that i would be getting 2 new samsung s7 edge phones, but just 5 days after buying them, one of my phones would turn off and on without warning and then i noticed the name "janice" on the date and time screen. i took the phone to best buy and they confirmed that my phone was a refurbished phone. the wwireless sales representative lied to me and he did not tell me that i would be getting a refurbished phone. in fact, on the invoice both phones are priced at the new phone price. i'm going to check with my state wwirelessorney general and the ftc. the reason i had to get a new phone was because my old phones motherboard was fried according to the wwireless representative, and the manufacturers warranty ran out about 5 months ago. i never dropped my phone, never got it wet, i had it in an otterbox at all times and took great care of it. i now wonder if i got a refurbished model of my old phone....that i still have to make payments on. this seems like fraudulent activity to me. plus, on the bogof phone, they put on my phone bill that we owe payments for the free phone!!!! i am so frustrated!

docs.title: Unlock phone denied
docs.text: 've tried on several occasions to unlock not 1 but 2 phones. the first one i can understand. it was a paid (contract) phone and when the contract was over i switched to a prepaid plan. i had the phone on the paid contract well over a year, the on the prepaid around 6 months. i was denied because i didn't have active service on the phone for 6 months was my response to the request. the current phone i have on the same prepaid account it is on auto pay directly from my bank account. it has been active since may or june of 2016, i am still getting the same response to the unlock request that it has not been active for 6 months. and no one at customer service (611) will help because i no longer have a contract.
